section.title: What is it
section.p: This is a model that demonstrates some aspects of Brane Calculus, a Computational Systems Biology research area originated by Luca Cardelli. It's related to process calculi, and also to membrane computing. "Brane" in this case is short for Membrane.

ol.li: Run the Java application through the Xholon GUI (org.primordion.xholon.app.Xhn.java), and select File --> Open --> memcomp --> BraneCalc1 --> BraneCalc1_xhn.
Expand the Controller node in the tree.
You should see a list of parameters in the console window.

section.title: Things to notice
section.p: The simulation will display a tree graph showing the complete composite structure hierarchy.

section.title: Credits and references
section.p: The various subsystems contained within this Xholon model, are based on the published work of Luca Cardelli and Gheorghe Paun.
Cardelli, L. (2004). Brane Calculi - Interactions of Biological Membranes. LNCS.

Cardelli, L. and Paun, Gh. (2005). A universality result for a (mem)brane calculus based on mate/drip operations. International Journal of Foundations of Computer Science, 17(1), pp 49-68. World Scientific Publishing Company.
